main event: On 20 August 1949 at approximately 0300 hours, a rancher in Llano, Texas observed a copper-colored aerial object with quarter-moon shapes for about 2.5 hours.
interesting points: The object was described as 25 feet high and 3-4 feet wide,It had eleven quarter-moon shapes that were 6 inches in diameter,It rose straight up to 250 feet in 15 minutes, moved south for 1500 feet in 2 hours, and did not make any sound during the observation.
witness description: The primary witness was a 54-year-old rancher with a cataract over one eye who appeared eccentric and interested in astronomy and geology.
